means: 不服从( defy的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: After that, life became a matter of defying school rules.
sentence.Network_cn: 从那以后，生活便成了处处与校规作对。

sentence.Network_en: Nearly eleven-thousand people have been arrested for defying the ban on street trading.
sentence.Network_cn: 将近有1.1万人因为违抗禁止在街上摆摊交易的禁令而被捕。

sentence.Network_en: Others maintain the violence is apolitical and the perpetrators are just gangs bent on defying authority.
sentence.Network_cn: 其他人坚称该暴力事件与任何政党无关，行凶者只是意欲反抗权威的一伙人。

PerfectNetExp.abs: he looked at me as if he was defying me to argue ., 他盯着我看 , 好像想激我与他争论.
defying imitation ; matchless ., 使难以模仿 ; 无比的.
defying convention , you are very innovative , and you have a vivid imagination ., 不屈从传统 , 有创新性和生动的想象力.

entry.def: If you defy someone or something that is trying to make you behave in a particular way, you refuse to obey them and behave in that way.

example.ex: This was the first (and last) time that I dared to defy my mother...
example.tran: 这是我第一次(也是最后一次)胆敢反抗我的母亲。

example.ex: Nearly eleven-thousand people have been arrested for defying the ban on street trading.
example.tran: 将近有1.1万人因为违抗禁止在街上摆摊交易的禁令而被捕。

entry.tran: 挑战;激;认为…不敢(或无法)（做）
entry.def: If you defy someone to do something, you challenge them to do it when you think that they will be unable to do it or too frightened to do it.

example.ex: I defy you to come up with one major accomplishment of the current Prime Minister...
example.tran: 我敢说你讲不出现任首相的哪怕一项重大成就。

example.ex: He looked at me as if he was defying me to argue.
example.tran: 他看着我，仿佛在激我与他争论。

entry.def: If something defies description or understanding, it is so strange, extreme, or surprising that it is almost impossible to understand or explain.

example.ex: When the flowers open in spring they fill the night air with a fragrance that defies description...
example.tran: 春天鲜花开放时，夜里的空气中会弥漫一种难以名状的香气。

example.ex: It's a devastating and barbaric act that defies all comprehension.
example.tran: 这种行为野蛮凶残、令人震惊，简直是不可理喻。

entry.def: If you say that someone defies their age, or defies the years, you mean that their appearance or behaviour suggests that they are younger than they really are.

example.ex: The singer continues to defy her age by wearing the scantiest of outfits.
example.tran: 那名女歌手依旧穿着非常暴露的服装，完全不似她这把岁数。

auth_sentence.content: Defying the laws of physics is not a premise.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Parliament backed Mr O'Neill, defying the court.

auth_sentence.content: How did the economy manage this gravity-defying stunt?
auth_sentence.res_content: How did the economy manage this gravity-defying stunt?
